name: Baytree House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean and tidy accommodation within a ten minute walk to the center of Harrogate.
reviews.title: Great B & B Close to Harrogate Center

reviews.text: Off street parking available, and a well presented and cooked Yorkshire breakfast which lives up to its award winning status in a very pleasant relaxing dining room.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a Luxury room on top floor, within the en-suite a small notice states if water pressure is low unhook and hold down shower head until water flows. The shower (power?) was poor during our visit, poor pressure or defective unit, and the reason it did not score five stars.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here early December for a little Christmas shopping with my daughter after being let down due to a double booking else where. So glad we were, this was a friendly, warm, exceptionally clean and beautiful hotel. We won't be staying anywhere else in future when we visit Harrogate. Food was excellent and location was perfect for walking into town. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone with high standards.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.text: First class B & B, made very welcome by Amanda & Simon. Room and breakfast 1st class. Hosts went out of there way, to get tickets for Ripley castle Christmas fair. Would definitely recommend, and its only 10 minutes walk to the centre of Harrogate.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: After reading the great reviews this guest house has received on this website, we were looking forward to staying here. The location of this B and B is ideal. It's in a lovely quiet street and is a short stroll from the centre of town, great if you want to go for a meal and have a bottle of wine. There is also off street parking. The house itself is lovely with lots of original features in the sitting room and hall. However, it's when you get into your rooms that you realise that it isn't all that great. As someone who suffers from a dust allergy, our room wasn't ideal. There was dust visible on a lot the surfaces. There was also visible water damage on the ceiling of the room. The room was tired, with wallpaper starting to peel from the wall. The light shade was interesting, as they used a lamp shade upside down as a shade hanging from the ceiling. There was also 5 ladybirds who were sharing the room with us. Don't know if they came in while the window was open or if they were already there. We opened the room as it was a bit stuffy. Overall, we slept well. Breakfast was nice, but bacon and muffins were a little overcooked and portions are small, especially the salmon and scrambled egg. Home made bread seems to be what they're plugging, and it's nice, but from a breadmaker. Not that there's anything wrong with a breadmaker! Owners are friendly. But a comment about being too busy on to Sunday as they were full was a bit strange, considering the economic climate, they should be grateful they have business. Overall, this is an okay place to stay. But at £95 a room living night, they could do much better. For an extra £25 you could stay in luxury at the nearby Rudding Park Hotel. So i wouldn't be back to this establishment and wouldn't recommend it to a friend as I believe you could get better elsewhere for the price they charge.
reviews.title: A little tired and dusty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely B and B, just 5 to 10mins stroll into the town. Large comfortable bed in the deluxe room we had with excellent power shower. The hosts Amanda and Simon were delightful and the breakfast was delicious with plenty of choice. Would recommend this establishment without hesitation.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a Saturday and Sunday night in February and loved it. The owners, Simon and Amanda, are lovely - so friendly and helpful. The quality of the breakfast and the service provided were fantastic. The property is beautiful, it's in a lovely residential area with easy parking and only a short walk to town. Our room was great with a huge and fantastically comfortable bed (Amanda did tell us it is their regulars' favourite bed so I guess we got lucky). It's room 9 if you want to ask for that one. The property is spotlessly clean. We ate at Mirabelle and Blue Orchid (which is Simon's favourite) and both were fantastic.
reviews.title: Perfect guest house

reviews.text: A fine B and B with friendly owners. It is clean and well located with nicely decorated rooms. It is 11 minutes walk from the town hall so is quiet but also near to amenities . It is near the bus route to Great Yarmouth and the owners make their own jams and have a clutch of cute Yoda dogs that live in the owners section. Parking is free on the road outside and seemed easy when I stayed.
reviews.title: Nice place and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this must have been our third stay in this lovely B&B and will be back! The Baytree House is very welcoming, clean, comfortable and serves an absolutely amazing breakfast. It is located in a lovely tree lined road which is a short 5-10 minute walk away from the town centre. Fantastic!
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay

reviews.text: Just back from another great visit to the Baytree B&B in Harrogate.
reviews.title: A Second Visit

reviews.text: Again, very comfortable rooms, superb customer service and home cooked breakfast.
reviews.title: AWSM

reviews.text: Well done Simon & Amanda, look forward to seeing you on my next visit.
reviews.title: January 2013

reviews.text: We (group of 8-10 women friends) have stayed in this pretty, warm b/b for several years now. It is within walking distance of the station and town centre. The rooms and breakfasts are very good and there is a comfortable sitting room for guests. The owners are lovely, helpful people - they even cleared the snow from our cars this year!
reviews.title: A fabulous Stay

reviews.text: This is the 3rd year of staying at Baytree House and soon to be booking the 4th. Great place to stay with great rooms and superb breakfasts. Amanda and Simon make you feel welcome from the minute you get there.
reviews.title: The best B&B in Harrogate - highly recommended

reviews.text: ... And in fact I don't really want to leave! I am lying on the very comfortable bed in room 5, happily full of a delicious breakfast ... And wishing I could stay another night. I am already in the habit of staying here whenever I visit relatives in Harrogate.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The rooms aren't huge, but always spotlessly clean, warm, welcoming and comfortable. There is a small car park, or parking discs if it's full, so you can park on the road.
reviews.title: Fantastic Classic English B&B

reviews.text: And gourmet food. You won't leave hungry in the morning!
reviews.title: Brilliant baytree

reviews.text: You really can't go wrong staying here. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Harrogate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in Baytree House while attending family wedding in Harrogate we actually live in USA. Had a lovely room with four poster bed (huge). Nice quiet house with tastefully thought out accent pieces and art throughout. As for the breakfast, you could have been in a five star gourmet hotel to get the quality locally sourced ingredients and attention to preferences. My poached eggs for instance were cooked to order exactly as requested as were scrambled egg. A rarity now days. Simon I REALLY need the recipe for your amazing linseed Bread ! Amanda is a ever smiling Hostess who made us feel welcome and relaxed. Five Stars for this outstanding B&B !!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay in a perfect location

description: Baytree House can be found on a quiet tree-lined avenue amidst the classic Victorian and Edwardian architecture that makes up the spa town Harrogate. All our rooms are en-suite with luxury finishes to enhance your stay. Treat yourself to afternoon tea with delicious homemade cakes and scones and a selection of tasty sandwiches! All room rates include our AWARD WINNING breakfast, parking and WIFI.
